The Bone Snatcher is about a group miners who go on a search for a missing crew of miners in the Namib Desert. When the find them, they do not realize that an alien monster is with them. Just when you think it can’t get worse than millions of years ago giant eagle flew over to devour man-size locusts, along comes this preacher who has every right to help them out but chooses to condemn some and praise others.

I saw it tonight and fell asleep in the movie.

That is something that I have not done since - I have never fallen asleep at a real movie, like going to the theater or whatever.
I was too tired, but John was there with me with approximately 20 other people. If any one of them noticed that I snoozed during this relatively short film I would guess either kind of laughed or were slightly annoyed<|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|>

While credited as a Tom and Jerry cartoon, this is not the cat-and-mouse team but an earlier Mutt-and-Jeff rip-off featuring them going about to survive in today's turbulent economy. In the end, they channel their problems over money and lose it all by making a super-sized funny-looking pay toilet.
CHasing stray kittens meet nightmare. Only Alan Partridge would refer someone's career demise cut short should they leave whilst on pilot duty.<|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|>

Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. The movie was decent produced though.
Definitely not worth to watch.
I was hoping for a treat seeing it was being presented as parody or homage.. this however turned out to be just another “Yuck” film. No wonder the critic’s worst 100 films ever list included this.<|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|>

What is left of Planet Earth is populated by a few poor and starving rag-tag survivors. They must eat bugs and insects, or whatever they can find. The wealthy fliers have long since left Planet Earth, for with enough money one could emigrate to Orbitals above where there seems to be plenty of wealth to enjoy by those that 'Made It'. Michael Dudikoff stars as Joe Armstrong a martial artist who fights ninjas who are stealing weapons from the U.S Army, in this entertaining yet admittedly brainless comedic action film. This film is clearly an attempt to catch the success of The Ninja by Sho Kosugi (1988). Summoned to Japan to stop smugglers, Joe is surprised when he finds out it is his own brothers biggest client!
